articles.author: James Mackenzie, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Samia Nakhoul
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah militant group said on Friday it was moving to a new and escalating phase in its war against Israel while Iran said "the spirit of resistance will be strengthened" after the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar.
articles.title: Hezbollah says it will escalate war with Israel after Hamas leader killed

articles.author: Jonathan Saul, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli troops were initially unaware they'd caught their number one enemy, officials said.
articles.title: Sinwar's death came at the end of months of searching by Israel

articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will on Friday seek to cement cooperation with key European partners on issues from the Ukraine war to conflict in the Middle East during a swift swansong trip to Berlin.
articles.title: Biden to discuss Ukraine with allies on swansong Berlin trip

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said South Korea is a foreign and hostile country, state media KCNA said on Friday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un says South Korea is a foreign, hostile country, KCNA says

articles.author: Daniel Leussink
articles.description: Having survived the atomic bomb that flattened his hometown of Hiroshima when he was nine months old, Kunihiko Sakuma has never forgotten the stain it left on him in the eyes of some of his fellow Japanese.
articles.title: Discrimination still haunts Japan's Nobel-winning A-bomb survivors

articles.author: Jan Strupczewski
articles.description: European Union leaders agreed on Thursday to use all their leverage, including trade, development aid and visa policy, to speed up returns of migrants illegally entering the bloc and asked the European Commission to urgently draft a law.
articles.title: EU leaders set course for tougher policy to send back irregular migrants

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesian police and military started deploying at least 100,000 personnel across the capital Jakarta on Friday, officials said, as the country prepares for the inauguration of President-elect Prabowo Subianto this weekend.
articles.title: Indonesia ramps up security ahead of Prabowo's inauguration

articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield, Aftab Ahmed
articles.description: In February 2020, Nasreen and her husband Tofik were living in Shiv Vihar, an upcoming neighbourhood in northeast New Delhi. But that month, riots erupted targeting Muslims like them and Tofik was pushed by a mob from the second floor of the building where they lived, according to a police report he filed days later from hospital.
articles.title: In Modi's Delhi, Indian Muslims segregate to seek security

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States has charged a former Indian intelligence officer who allegedly directed a foiled plot to murder a Sikh separatist in New York City last year, the Washington Post reported on Thursday, citing American officials.
articles.title: US charges ex-Indian intelligence official in foiled Sikh murder plot, Washington Post reports

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Nandita Bose
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris is shifting her campaign strategy to win over more men and Republicans, and sharpening her attacks on Donald Trump as Democratic anxieties rise over polls showing her rival making strong gains.
articles.title: Harris campaign shifts strategy as anxiety rises over Trump gains
